Hi,

My understanding is once a link passes the scope test, and then later gets redirected doesn't go through the SURT test again, this was a problem for me and what I did was to include a SURT filter in Preprocessor under sub-modules tab. And this fixed my problem.

Not sure if understand it right, but what I would like to know is, What do we get by having a filter in Preprocessor?.

Thanks,
Manav



Anmol Bhasin <anmol.bhasin@...> wrote:                                  Hi,

A lil help would be greatly appreciated. I am curious about how Heritrix is handling Redirects. 

Per my understanding, The HTTP Method in the source is by default not allowed to follow the Redirection. The Transclusion filter checks for Refer Hops to ensure that the URI is in scope or not. 

Assuming this is true, I wished to Crawl a Host+1 level outlinks, for which I employed the Decider Rule Sequence Based on SURT prefixes and placed "Check Via" to true, undoubtedly it produces the desired result, but then I face this issue, if the (+1) link returns a Redirect (301/302) then that page does not get fetched as I understand that the Referer page does not fall within the SURT prefix set anymore. Am I interpreting the problem correctly? If yes, then is there is a solution to this issue. 

Anmol
